threads.name: Anonymous
threads.com:
Fat loss Assist Thread
Because weight loss start at /ck/ and not /fit/

>Who is /fat/ for?
For ducks and nuns who are working towards a better physique through meaningful hard-work, strategy, and dedication. This is not QTDDTOT, stick to questions on fat loss. Post height and weight when asking for advice.
Join our Fatty Contest: https://www.fattycontest.com/

>What do I do first?
1. Read https://physiqonomics.com/fat-loss/
2. Calculate your Body Fat Percentage: https://fitness.bizcalcs.com/Calculator.asp?Calc=Body-Fat-Navy
3. Calculate your TDEE: https://www.sailrabbit.com/bmr/
Remember to use bodyfat% and use Katch-McArdle Formula with sedentary settings or your TDEE will be too high.
4. Plan your weight loss: https://www.losertown.org/eats/cal.php
5. Track your nutrition with MyFitnessPal (better for packaged food), Cronometer (better for generic food/macros) or LoseIt (great for both).

>Now what?
Count calories, all of them.
Eat about 500-1000 less calories than your TDEE.
Buy scales, be accurate.
Learn to cook. Try to stick to lean protein and green vegetables.
Eat a lot of protein. 0.72g per lb of goal lean body mass.
Doing cardio, even just walking, will improve your health. There is no such thing as a healthy fat heart, but you can offset the risks.
Lifting weights will keep and gain muscle mass and burn fat much quicker. No lifting results in the body burning away muscle AND fat.
Drink more water.

>DON'T
Eat refined sugars, they're terrible for you regardless of calories.
Eat processed foods.
Drink your calories (alcohol, soda, starbucks).
Freak out over a weight loss stall. Plateaus can last up to three weeks.
"Reward" yourself. Cheat days cheat only yourself.
Be a ketolard

last_replies.com:
Think of nutrition as a balancing act
You want a certain amount of x things in y calories
Fast food can offer you nutrition it just isn't going to be in the same density as healthier options, but they also taste way better so you have to balance it.
Essentially, you need to define your goals and then factor that in to what you eat.
My goals are
>Gaining muscle mass
>Maintaining a low body fat %
>watching what I eat in reference to acne prone skin
So with that in mind, my food choices are
>Higher protein to calorie ratio foods like Lean fish, Eggs and Egg whites, spinach
>Highly satiating carbs such as Potatoes and Sweet Potatoes. Popcorn (depending on the brand) is another great option, I recommend Orville Redenbacher's and one of those smart pop boxes since its the lowest calorie one you find in supermarkets, just use a popcorns seasoning on it
>I avoid Dairy (except Greek yogurt and the occasional fast food) and highly sugary foods (again, outside of occasion I just don't keep them in my house) because most are calorie dense but more because it will make my skin break out.
Hope this helps anon, find your goals and work from there. Daves Killer Bread is also good shit

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
From whence does goyslop derive its timeless origin in the domain of Forms? We must ask ourselves, what is the nature of the Divine Goyslop that has instantiated itself in certain kinds of foods? In the most fundamental sense, goyslop is food which the goyim are fed or encouraged to eat by the tribe. If we are to deduce which types of foods most closely adhere to the Form of the Goyslop, we must look to which types of foods are most often peddled by merchants. When we do this, we see that they tend to peddle high fat, highly processed meats, beans and bean derivatives (particularly soy), and, indeed, starchy grains. So, it would seem that your friend is correct. Grains derive their goyslopness, if you will, from their characteristic proximity to the Form of the Goyslop, that transcendant divinity which is incorporeal and fundamentally Jewish in nature.

On the other hand, consider that goyslop containing rice or grains is incidental. These things would exist and be consumed without goyim to consume them or merchants to peddle them. When someone eats goyslop, therefore, we do not say that what he is eating is goyslop because of the type of food that it is, but because it fulfills the existential criterion of being peddled by one specific group to another specific group. If beef fit this criteria, it would be goyslop. If potatoes fit this criteria, they too would be goyslop. In our case, starchy grains do generally tend to be in this category. But none of these things are necessarily a part of the Form of the Goyslop, something which has its timeless origin in the domain of Forms before it could ever become instantiated in the realm of Bodies. Was the Roman poet Horace being fed goyslop when he described the precursor to lasagna, laganum, in the first century A.D.? I don't think that anyone would claim he was. Thus we see that grains can sometimes *incidentally* be called goyslop, but there is nothing inherent to their nature that makes them so.
